Bronisław Kasper Malinowski

Author of Argonauts of the Western Pacific, a Founding Father of Ethnographic Fieldwork

  • 1884 - Born in Kraków, to an upper-middle class Polish family.
  • 1908 - Received his doctorate in philosophy and mathematics. Shortly afterward became influenced by James Frazer's The Golden Bough and developed an interest in anthropology
  • 1910 - Went to England, studying at the London School of Economics
  • 1914 - Travelled to Papua, conducting fieldwork at Mailu Island and the Trobriand Islands
  • 1920 - Published a scientific article on the Kula Ring
  • 1922 - Earned his doctorate in Social Anthropology and published the first edition of Argonauts of the Western Pacific

Wikipedia entry for Bronisław Malinowski available here
